events.message: Customer reported a car accident involving their vehicle on the highway, resulting in visible front-end damage.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident based on the customer’s description and vehicle involved.
An insurance agent was assigned to oversee the investigation and communication for the accident claim.
Acknowledgment email sent to the customer confirming receipt of the claim and promising prompt assistance.
Requested police report, photographs of the vehicle damage, and the driver’s license for claim processing.
Customer uploaded all requested documents including accident report and vehicle repair estimate promptly.
An inspector was dispatched to assess the damage to the vehicle and verify the details provided.
Inspection confirmed the collision damage as reported, validating all submitted documents and statements.
A proposed settlement amount covering repairs and rental car costs was sent to the customer for review.
Customer responded positively to the settlement offer and expressed satisfaction with the claim handling process.
The claim was approved based on investigation results and customer agreement with the settlement terms.
Payment covering the agreed settlement amount was transferred to the customer's bank account promptly.
The claim was officially closed after issuance of payment and confirmation of repair scheduling by the customer.
